title: Great 1br apartment by Clark Park for 7/1
description:
Cozy, bright, corner 1br apartment in a great location, available 7/1. Recommended for people looking to move to the area, ppl working downtown, or those attending/working at Drexel, UPenn, University of the Sciences, even Temple.
The apartment will be EMPTY & clean when you move in. I've lived here since April 2021 and quite like it, but I have to terminate the lease early and find a replacement as I'm buying a house! I've lived in many different buildings around West Philly since 2005, and this is one of the better ones I've experienced.
THE BASICS
•  12 month lease starting 7/1/22 w/New Horizons Housing — plz note that my particular apartment is NOT listed on their website.
•  $50 non-refundable application fee
•  Credit score of at least 625 or higher with no prior evictions
(an acceptance letter to a local university will suffice to circumvent the credit score requirement in the case of a credit score of N/A).
•  "As-is" move-in - I will def be cleaning the place thoroughly before I move, but New Horizons will not paint before the new tenant moves in.
•  No dogs, but cats are welcome (I do not have either)
•  Proof of income (unemployment can not be used as proof of income)
•  Move-in Costs are First Month, Last Month, and Security for total of $3030 + $12.50 in-house renter's insurance [or you can get your own renter's insurance, but if you don't they require you to pay theirs]
THE PLACE
•  Royal Chester Court at 4601 Chester Ave, located in an area with mature trees all around and many beautiful homes and their gardens.
•  2nd floor apartment in a brick building. 4 floors, no elevator, and coin-op laundry in the basement.
•  Apt itself has one large main room, a smaller room with corner windows, a separate bathroom, separate kitchen area, and 3 closets of varying size.
•  Gets nice and bright indirect light, and doesn't get too hot in summertime (but def put an AC in). The photos you'll see are all from an overcast early afternoon time this week.
•  Radiator heat that's nice and warm.
•  Building maintenance is responsive and quick to show up for the most part, and this building is actively cared for, which... in my experience, has been rare in other rental situations I've been in over the years.
•  PEOPLE OF SIZE: Bathtub is quite small, and the bathroom itself could be tight. As a straight sized person it works for me.
THE AREA
•  4601 Chester Ave is on the corner of 46th and Chester Aves. The 13 trolley catches right on the corner, and you can free transfer onto the El blue line (east/west) at 30th street station, or ride to 15th/City Hall station for free transfer to the Broad Street Subway (north/south). The 34 trolley also catches 2 blocks over on Baltimore Ave.
•  Clark Park is one block away. Nice green space and people watching. Woodlands Cemetery is another great nearby greenspace.
•  Restaurants, corner stores, and cafes a-plenty.
•  If you have a car, you'll need a $35 one-time residential parking permit. During the day you can park right in front of the building, but later in the night I tend to have to park a block or two away.
And here is how the landlord New Horizons describes the same place:
•  Sunny One Bedroom Apartment with Heat & Hot Water Included…Just blocks from University of the Sciences
•  Students and professionals can both enjoy the benefits of living in this University City apartment located at 46th and Chester Avenue. Walk to classes within minutes, or hop on the 13 Trolley that runs down Chester Avenue and be in Center City in less than 15 minutes. Relax in beautiful Clark Park, just a block from the building, and enjoy the weekly farmer’s market every Saturday.
•  This building features laundry facilities on-site and plenty of easy on-street parking. Heat and hot water are included in your rent! Every kitchen includes a stove and refrigerator. Safely lock your bike in the building's courtyard on one of the provided bike racks.
•  Baltimore Avenue is just a few blocks away and features a variety of restaurants, salons, and local businesses including Mariposa Food Co-op, Dock Street Brewery, Vientiane Café, Talking Heads Hair Salon and Firehouse Bicycles. Also in the neighborhood is Fresh Grocer, The Rave movie theater, and CVS Pharmacy for convenient shopping.
•  Throughout the year, enjoy the wide variety of community events offered to you in University City, including the Baltimore Avenue Dollar Stroll, University City Dining Days, craft shows and flea markets, Shakespeare (and movies!) in Clark Park, and free outdoor concerts at 40th Street.
Amenities
USP student off-campus housing
heat included
hot-water included
high-speed internet ready
on-site laundry
new kitchens & baths
updated appliances
refinished hardwood floors
access to Trolley
2-blocks to USP
academic-year leases available

description:
The home at 2109 is a 875 square foot Picasso one bedroom one bathroom apartment home on the 21st floor that features large windows that face south and have a view of Chancellor Street and in a building located on Rittenhouse Square! This renovated, fully-equipped kitchen features a gas stove, microwave, disposal, and dishwasher. The bathroom is renovated as well. This home features wood floors. There is abundant closet space for plenty of storage. Move into your new home as early as July 15, 2022!
The Rittenhouse Claridge offers you the opportunity to live in Philadelphia’s most vibrant, walkable neighborhood. So close to grocery stores, retail shops, coffee shops, restaurants, and entertainment venues! Target, Trader Joe's, Giant, Sue's Produce Market, Rittenhouse Market, Spruce Food Market, and Di Bruno Bros. are grocery stores within walking distance! Retail stores on Rittenhouse Row include Anthropologie, Barnes & Noble, Lagos, Tumi, Tiffany & Co., Lovesac, Athleta, lululemon, Indochino, Madewell, Boyds, Sephora, and Nordstrom Rack. Sip a cappuccino at Ultimo, La Colombe, Elixr, Miel Patisserie, and Gran Caffe L'Aquila. Nearby dining options include: Rouge, Parc, Pietro's Coal Oven Pizzeria, Devon Seafood Grill, a.bar, a.kitchen, Spice Finch, Via Locusta, The Love, Alice Pizza, and Marathon Grill.

title: Full 6-bed house, avail - Sept 1 - Clark Park - $3,600 Penn/Alexander
description:
Hello,
We have an entire, six-bedroom house available for rent September 1st for $3,600. (It could be available August 1st, and it's possible to have a long-term lease.
The house is pretty neat. It has three bedrooms with closets and bath with a tub on the the third floor. There is also a 4th bedroom which is quite small, but quirky and functional. The small bed room does not have a closet, but there is a hall closet. Also, the rear bedroom has a door that allows you to walk out on to a small, rear roof.
The second floor has two bedrooms with closets and which have an adjoining door. There is another bathroom with a claw foot tub and a large front room which could be a bedroom, although we've used it as a family room.
The ground floor has a kitchen, pantry, mud room, half bath, dining room and a front parlor (which currently has a piano). There is a front porch and front garden, rear deck and rear yard. We're super lucky because a quirk of the backyards has given us a great, back-yard view. There's also a basement with washer/dryer.
Hardwood floors throughout and ceiling fans original fixtures. The house is currently furnished and we are welcome to lease it 'as is', if folks need furniture, or we can remove as much as needed.
Tenants pay water, gas, wi-fi and electric - although we have solar panels, so the electric has never been more than $10 and has only been $0 for the last year.
The location is pretty great. Right on Clark Park, so you've got easy access to the 34 trolley, Baltimore Ave shopping, local restaurants, coffeeshops, etc.
Oh, and it's in the Penn-Alexander school catchment for those of you with little ones!
Thanks and welcome to W Philly.
Milan (He/Him)
